This is really the first cheating tag Doujin that I saw that actually portrayed it in a realistic light. The guy is a coward, yes, insincere and everything, but it shows that the reason he just doesn't outright give her to the school authorities it's because of his human side not wanting to destroy the Senpai who he thinks highly of. Of course, he does it because he thinks she's a good person, when she is showing to be not, and that last part is the last straw for him. The thing is, by not telling his girlfriend the truth, he will potentially lose her.
Not the usual NTR shit about ''being taken away/succumbing to pleasure'', but showing that he actually feels good, but feels even more guilty about his relationship with senpai. The thing is that she too raped him in the first chapter, so maybe they will make up in the end. At least I hope so.

I really like how the author has drastically improved his sense of drawing. In the first part, it feels as if he put all of his effort on details on their faces alone, however as this series goes by, you can actually tell that he improved the shadowing, texture and background drawings of every manga panel. Not to mention, it has a story that you can keep forward to! Keep up the good work!

Whelp, MC realized he got himself into a messed up situation.  But instead of keeping it a secret and letting the affair go on like in usual NTRs, he throws himself under the bus for the sake of getting evidence to expose both of them.  Though I don't think he wanted Kurumi to find out about the affair the way she did at the eng.  Also, if you look at the left edge of the cover, you'll see someone's knee ( most likely Senpai ).  Hinting the cover is not complete.  so this will probably end the same way SISUANA - Sister Hole by Nakano Sora did.  All that said, #HereBeforePopular.
